  • Method Details

    • clusterName

      public String clusterName()

    • resolveNames

      public void resolveNames​(String indexWildcard, String javaRegex, EnumSet<IndexResolver.IndexType> types, org.elasticsearch.action.ActionListener<Set<IndexResolver.IndexInfo>> listener)
      Resolves only the names, differentiating between indices and aliases. This method is required since the other methods rely on mapping which is tied to an index (not an alias).

    • resolveAsMergedMapping

      public void resolveAsMergedMapping​(String indexWildcard, String javaRegex, org.elasticsearch.action.support.IndicesOptions indicesOptions, org.elasticsearch.action.ActionListener<IndexResolution> listener)
      Resolves a pattern to one (potentially compound meaning that spawns multiple indices) mapping.

    • resolveAsMergedMapping

      public void resolveAsMergedMapping​(String indexWildcard, String javaRegex, boolean includeFrozen, org.elasticsearch.action.ActionListener<IndexResolution> listener)
      Resolves a pattern to one (potentially compound meaning that spawns multiple indices) mapping.

    • mergedMappings

      public static IndexResolution mergedMappings​(DataTypeRegistry typeRegistry, String indexPattern, String[] indexNames, Map<String,​Map<String,​org.elasticsearch.action.fieldcaps.FieldCapabilities>> fieldCaps)

    • resolveAsSeparateMappings

      public void resolveAsSeparateMappings​(String indexWildcard, String javaRegex, boolean includeFrozen, org.elasticsearch.action.ActionListener<List<EsIndex>> listener)
      Resolves a pattern to multiple, separate indices. Doesn't perform validation.

    • separateMappings

      public static List<EsIndex> separateMappings​(DataTypeRegistry typeRegistry, String javaRegex, String[] indexNames, Map<String,​Map<String,​org.elasticsearch.action.fieldcaps.FieldCapabilities>> fieldCaps, org.elasticsearch.common.collect.ImmutableOpenMap<String,​List<org.elasticsearch.cluster.metadata.AliasMetadata>> aliases)
